On Wed, 2002-10-02 at 12:15, Berin Loritsch wrote:

> > Why not rewrite JUnit the way you are envisioning and see how it works &
> > how people like it?  Nobody said you *HAVE* to use JUnit.
> 
> I like JUnit for the most part.  It's those boundary cases where JUnit
> shows its limitations.  IMO the boundaries should be a little bit wider.

That's true of many tools.  They do well for how they're used most of
the time, and start breaking down on the fringes.
 
> Any way, if you want to pay me to do the work, I will be happy to do it.

Haha.  I'm afraid not :-)

> Until then I have other projects and bigger "itches" to scratch that
> take up my time--not to mention raising a family, my day job, and my
> other hobbies.

Hobbies.. cool.  Does writing count?  It's sort of my day job at the
moment... until we land a client anyway :(

We have a few project of our own we're hoping to tackle.

Dave
